result.execSummary:
The defendant Donald L. Mielke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Capture an Image of Nudity, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 942.09(2)(am)1.
  • Capture an Image of Nudity, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 942.09(2)(am)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: **Corrected on 06-03-2015 to reflect that all Court obligations should be paid directly to the Clerk of Courts Office.**

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs.   **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
------------------------

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence.
------------------------

No contact with victim without Agent's approval. No contact with minors without Agent's permission.
------------------------

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.  Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.  The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees. The defendant does NOT have to register as a sex offender pursuant to Court's ruling.
------------------------

timeConds.notes: with work release privileges to commence on or before 7-17-2015 at 8:00 a.m. Court STAYS six (6) months of the conditional release jail time. The defendant is to serve the first thirty (30) days of remaining six (6) months with NO work release privileges. The remaining conditional release jail time to be served WITH work release privileges.

Defendant Donald L. Mielke in court with attorney Marc Efton Christopher.  Haley Jo Rea appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Preliminary hearing requested. Minutes filed.

BOND TO BE CO-SIGNED BY KAREN MIELKE. Defendant must abide by and comply with the terms of the INjunction in files 2014CV000094, 2014CV000095, 2014CV000096, 2014CV00097. If the injunctions are dismissed, the original no contact condition will go back into place. Not to possess or use any device capable of accessing the Internet. Not to possess or use any camera or video recording equipment. The Defendant may use his smart phone for business purposes only.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
